bibl.title: A New NT Papyrus: P126 (PSI 1497).
bibl.note: P.S.I. XV, 1497 (= LDAB 10009). - The folio, which was part of a big manuscript, bears a numbering of pages which indicates a place for Hebrews among the Pauline letters not attested in any other manuscript. On the other hand, it exhibits a unique variant of Heb 13:12 ἔξω τῆς πύλης τῆς παρεμβολῆς ἔπαθεν, which may challenge the interpretation of this passage put forward by Tertullian and still maintained today by scholars.
bibl.seg: Claire Clivaz, A New NT Papyrus: P126 (PSI 1497).

P.S.I. XV, 1497 (= LDAB 10009). - The folio, which was part of a big manuscript, bears a numbering of pages which indicates a place for Hebrews among the Pauline letters not attested in any other manuscript. On the other hand, it exhibits a unique variant of Heb 13:12 ἔξω τῆς πύλης τῆς παρεμβολῆς ἔπαθεν, which may challenge the interpretation of this passage put forward by Tertullian and still maintained today by scholars.
